generic.label: Learn to Automate Your Factory's Incident Reporting: A Step by Step Guide
How to automate every step of an incident response workflow

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Create an incident

options.name: Create
options.description: Create an incident

options.name: Get
options.description: Get an incident

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many incidents

options.name: Update
options.description: Update an incident

properties.name: title
properties.description: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident

properties.name: serviceId
properties.description: The incident will be created on this service. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: Delegate this incident to the specified escalation policy. Cannot be specified if an assignee is given. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: escalationPolicyId
options.description: Delegate this incident to the specified escalation policy. Cannot be specified if an assignee is given. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: details
options.description: Additional details about the incident which will go in the body

options.name: incidentKey
options.description: Sending subsequent requests referencing the same service and with the same incident_key will result in those requests being rejected if an open incident matches that incident_key

options.name: priorityId
options.description: The incident will be created on this service. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: urgency
options.description: The urgency of the incident

properties.name: conferenceBridgeUi
properties.description: Phone numbers should be formatted like +1 415-555-1212,,,,1234#, where a comma (,) represents a one-second wait and pound (#) completes access code input

values.name: conferenceNumber
values.description: Phone numbers should be formatted like +1 415-555-1212,,,,1234#, where a comma (,) represents a one-second wait and pound (#) completes access code input

values.name: conferenceUrl
values.description: An URL for the conference bridge. This could be a link to a web conference or Slack channel.

properties.name: incidentId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the incident

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: options
properties.description: When set to all, the since and until parameters and defaults are ignored

options.name: dateRange
options.description: When set to all, the since and until parameters and defaults are ignored

options.name: incidentKey
options.description: Incident de-duplication key. Incidents with child alerts do not have an incident key; querying by incident key will return incidents whose alerts have alert_key matching the given incident key.

options.name: include
options.description: Additional details to include

options.name: serviceIds
options.description: Returns only the incidents associated with the passed service(s). Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

options.name: since
options.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. (the limit on date ranges is 6 months).

options.name: sortBy
options.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (incident_number/created_at/resolved_at/urgency), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma.

options.name: statuses
options.description: Returns only the incidents associated with the passed service(s)

options.name: teamIds
options.description: Team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the teams ability to use this parameter. (multiples IDs can be added separated by comma)

options.name: timeZone
options.description: Time zone in which dates in the result will be rendered. If not set dates will return UTC. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: until
options.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. (the limit on date ranges is 6 months).

options.name: urgencies
options.description: Urgencies of the incidents to be returned. Defaults to all urgencies. Account must have the urgencies ability to do this

options.name: userIds
options.description: Returns only the incidents currently assigned to the passed user(s). This expects one or more user IDs (multiple IDs can be added separated by comma).

properties.name: incidentId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the incident

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request

properties.name: updateFields
properties.description: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy

options.name: escalationLevel
options.description: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy

options.name: escalationPolicyId
options.description: Delegate this incident to the specified escalation policy. Cannot be specified if an assignee is given. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: priorityId
options.description: The incident will be created on this service. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: resolution
options.description: The resolution for this incident if status is set to resolved

options.name: status
options.description: The new status of the incident

options.name: title
options.description: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident

options.name: urgency
options.description: The urgency of the incident

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
